intro: Galium × barcinonense, commonly known as the hybrid wood sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ability to spread vegetatively, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
